entry.title: Ukraine Loses Ground in Battle for Severodonetsk but Gains Firepower From U.S.
entry.content: Russian forces captured two villages southwest of Lysychansk and looked to control a third as they pushed toward the river bank west of Severodonetsk.

entry.title: Nuclear Power Is Poised for a Comeback. The Problem Is Building the Reactors.
entry.content: Western countries are making big bets on nuclear energy to help tackle climate change and reduce dependence on Russian oil and gas, but are short on experience in building the plants after shunning them for years.

entry.title: Ukrainian Farmers Harvest Wheat Amid Russian Rockets, Crossfire
entry.content: Russia’s invasion has hit some of Ukraine’s most productive agricultural land, disrupting supplies and pushing up food prices. As harvest season begins, farmers are feeling the heat of relentless fighting.

entry.title: Pope's Wariness of U.S.-Dominated World Shapes Russia, China Stances
entry.content: Pope Francis’ reluctance to condemn without qualification Russia’s aggression against a sovereign nation state has raised eyebrows within and far beyond the Catholic Church.
